dict.string:
The first human ancestors appeared 4 million yeas ago in the forests of East Africa.
The oldest species were called Australopithecines. They already walked in two legs, and it seems that this property allowed them very important for their success. They managed to live in a diversity of environments, from forests to savannah.

Evolving Planet story unfolds in an imaginary exoplanet called Kepler-1138.
An exoplanet is a planet that orbits a star other than the Sun. Over 2.000 exoplanets have been discovered, most of them by the Kepler space telescope since its launch by NASA in 2009.

Homo Sapiens is 200.000 years old. They appeared in East Africa, and only moved out of it 100.000 years ago.
The rest of the dispersal was extremely fast: they colonized almost the entire planet in 85.000 years.

"You look at science as some sort of demoralising invention of man, something apart from real life, and which must be cautiously guarded and kept separate from everyday existence. But science and everyday life cannot and should not be separated."
Rosalind Franklin was one of the discoverers of the DNA structure. Her research was crucial to understand how life evolves.

Australopithecus, Homo Habilis or Homo Neanderthal were different species of hominins.
They were quite diverse, but all of them shared being bipeds, having small teeth and big brains. Homo Sapiens is the hominin still alife.

The Tubu live in an African region called Ténéré, "the country of emptiness". The women are able to find the only water well in thousands of squared kilometers with the only orientation of dune movement and the stars. Culture is a powerful tool, and thanks to it we populate the entire surface of the planet.

Radiocarbon dating revolutionized archaeology during late-XXth century.
This technique allows to date organic materials found in an excavation, thus allowing researchers to know the age of the site.

The british ship HMS Beagle left Plymouth in 1831 towards South America. She returned to Europe 5 years later after circumnavigating the Earth. Her crew included a young man called Charles Darwin. The data he collected during the voyage was crucial to develop his theory of evolution by natural selection.

The first pregnancy for women in current hunter-gatherer societies is around 19 years. This was probably the case for people living in all the planet until the adoption of sedentary lifestyles such as farming made it decrease.
It did not increase again in Western societies until the XXth century.

"Change is the principal feature of our age and literature should explore how people deal with it. The best science fiction does that, head-on." David Brin
Speculation on the impact of technological advances on society is one of the basis of Science-Fiction. Some of the best examples are the novels "I, Robot" (Isaac Asimov) and "The Stars my Destination (Alfred Bester) and the movie "Blade Runner" (Ridley Scott).

Our ancestors started using tools 2 million ago. This technology was not an isolated innovation, as other cultural traits need to be present in order to communicate this knowledge.
For this reason it is not surprising that hominins started speaking during the same period.

"Science is the belief in the ignorance of experts." Richard Feynman
One of the most important physicists of the XXth century.

The first project to connect the Atlantic and the Pacific oceans through Panama was ordered by the Emperor Charles I in 1534.
However, technical and economical limits stopped any initiative until its construction in 1914 by the US and Panama.

The more we know about Neanderthals the more we see the striking similarities between them and us. This interest has not only generated scientific debate but also several fiction works.
Three of the most interesting are the movie "Quest for Fire" by Jean-Jacques Annaud, the historical novel "The Clan of the Cave Bear" by J.M. Auel and the science-fiction trilogy "The Neanderthal Parallax", by Robert J. Sawyer.
You are not the first one
Christoper Columbus famous voyage from 1492 was not the first contact between Europeans and Americans. Several viking expeditions reached Northern America during the Xth century.

Advances in biology demonstrate that part of our genetic information comes from Neanderthals. They are not our ancestors, so this genetic share was caused by both species coexisting and interbreeding in Europe 35.000 years ago.
Recent research suggests that current allergies are produced by 3 genes inherited from Neanderthals through hybridation.
Culture is not property of humans. Apes, dolphins and orcas show complex cultural traits such as tools and language. However, the pace at which we learn and create new ideas makes us quite unique.

"Violence is the last refuge of the incompetent." Isaac Asimov
Novelist, humanist, scientist, professor, communicator...Asimov is one of the most versatile and brilliant minds of the XXth century. Works such as the "Foundation" trilogy and "I, Robot" shaped the way we think about our future.

The first evidences of warfare are currently dated around 13.000 years ago. Conflict scenes are depicted in several cave paintings, and archaeologists have also found several bodies embedding arrowheads.

"I feel alive when I ride my horse"
These are words from a Mongol horse rider whom was said to be "born in the saddle". Mongols are nomads living in the steppe, where their culture is centered around horses.

This huge stone heads are called Moais, and they were discovered in the Easter island in the Pacific ocean.
Their builders were part of the Polynesian people that colonized this zone 1.000 years ago. Overexploitation and contact with Europeans almost anihilated the population.

One of the first documentaries ever made tried to explain to Western people how was hunter-gatherer life. "Nanook of the North" was filmed by Robert J. Flaherty in 1922. It explained the struggle for survival of a family of Inuit living in the Arctic under extreme conditions.

Temperature in the Arctic can go as low as -45 degrees Celsius. Igloos made of snow and ice are the only reason why people can live there; they can increase the temperature up to a confortable 16 degrees.

Music developed at the same time than other artistic expressions such as drawings and jewelry.
This flute is 43.000 years old, and it was found in a Southern Germany cave called Geisenklosterle.

Conflict with Sapiens? Climate change? Competition for resources? We don't know why Neanderthals became extinct and we are fascinated about it.
Understanding the extinction of Neanderthals could help us understand the risks we currently face.
Some of the workers depicted in this famous photograph are Mohawk Indians. During the late XIXth century they became valued skilled workers for being able to work at very high altitudes.

“The good thing about science is that it's true whether or not you believe in it.” Neil deGrasse Tyson
He is one of the most renowned astrophysicists and science communicators.
This is the first draft of our logo! It was born in a bar, as other good ideas.

"When we saw so many cities and villages built in the water and other great towns on dry land we were amazed (...) some of our soldiers even asked whether the things that we saw were not a dream?"
These words were written Bernal Díaz del Castillo referring to Tenochtitlan, capital of the aztecs. He was a soldier during the conquest of Mexico by Hernán Cortés in 1519.

Imagine that you are a fisher in a seaside town. You realize that the number of catches is decreasing so you should stop fishing for a while. However, if the rest of the people will not stop, why would you be the only one starving?
This situation is called the tragedy of the commons, and it explains why overexploitation exists. It can only be solved by coordinating the whole community.

The finding of several cave paintings created the wrong idea that our ancestors lived inside them.
This topic is not correct; they moved around the territory and only used caves occasionally as a refuge. Paintings in caves have just better chance to be preserved after thousands of years.

Stratigraphy is one of the key concepts in current archeology.
Do you see different horizontal colored layers in this cut? Each one of them belongs to a different temporal period. The deeper they go, the older they are.

Wood is one of the most widely used natural resources.
Fuel, housing, ships...overexploitation almost destroyed the majority of European forests.
If you visit a European country now you will see more trees than in any other moment of the last 2.000 years.

Most population in Himalaya practice Buddishm. Believers of this religion are supposed to burn their deaths, but where are you supposed to find wood at at height of 4.000 meters?
They practice a different ritual called Sky Burial: corpses are placed on a mountaintop, where they are consumed by scanvenging birds such as vultures.
How much deep can you go underwater? The Sama-Bajau people can catch a fish at 20 m. deep while keeping their breadth for almost 3 minutes.

This rock is called lapis lazuli. It can only be mined in Afghanistan, but archaeologists have found it in art from all over the world. This is evidence of long-range trade.
For example, the eyebros of the famous Tutankhamon's funeral mask are made of this material.

The Silk Road is one of the most famous trade routes in History.
It started its activity 2.000 years ago, and connected the whole Eurasia, from the Mediterranean to Eastern China. It also had extensions towards Africa and the Pacific islands.

Trade was usually performed as a barter exchange between different goods.
The first coins were probably used 3000 years ago. They simultaneously appeared in current India, Greece and Turkey.

This is Ötzi. He was killed 5.000 years ago in the Alps. The cold temperatures naturally transformed his body into a mummy.
The study of his body has provided an enormous amount of information, including diet, clothes, tools and tatoos.

Obsidian was one of the most valued materials in Prehistory.
This volcanic glass was used to create sharp objects such as arrowheads and knives.

Archaeologists are able to determine the volcanic field where a piece of obsidian formed.
This is an excellent indicator of prehistoric trade. Obsidian objects have been found at sites thousands of kilometers far from the place of origin.

A common misconception of evolution assumes that it is directional and progressive.
Nothing further from the real theory: Darwin drafted this tree amongst his notes highlighting the similarities between life and its branched structure.

The domestication of plants and animals is one of the major changes in the history of the human species.
Archaeological evidence suggests that this process happened independently in at least three different places: Middle East, China and Africa.

“I don't care that they stole my idea . . I care that they don't have any of their own” Nikola Tesla
This brilliant inventor is responsible for the fact that you are able to power this device with electricity.

The Neolithic is the transition from a lifestyle based on hunting and gathering to a different one based on farming and herding.
This domestication did not only affect plants and animals, but also the humans. It radically transformed their culture, including their diet, mobility and communication.

Climate is constantly changing. Archaeologists have found evidence of wheat cultivation thousands of years ago in the Orkney islands, near the famous site of Skara Brae.
Temperatures decreased over the years until this was not longer possible. However, rapid climate change generated by humans could change this in the next decades.
Do you use Mozilla Firefox? Type 'about:robots' in the address bar to see a geek Easter Egg!

Your bots have a positronic brain following the 3 Robot Laws introduced by Isaac Asimov in 1942:
1. A robot may not injure a human being or, through inaction, allow a human being to come to harm. 2. A robot must obey the orders given it by human beings except where such orders would conflict with the First Law. 3. A robot must protect its own existence as long as such protection does not conflict with the First or Second Laws.
Miners working in the island of Java have probably the most dangerous job in the world. They have to work inside the guts of the Lijen volcano to collect sulphur.

Some people affirm that Intelligent Design is a theory as good as Evolution to explain life.
However, Evolution is a scientific theory while Intelligent Design is a religious argument lacking empirical support and does not offer any explanation that could be tested.

The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) was created by the United Nations to study climate change.
It has collected evidence from thousands of studies to show the dangerous effects of human activity on the planet.

The moon landing conspiracy suggests that the mission was filmed by director Stanley Kubrick on Earth. In reality this director and NASA only shared cameras. Some scenes of his movie Barry Lindon were filmed using just candlelight, thanks to a camera model owned by the space agency.

"I am one of those who think like Nobel, that humanity will draw more good than evil from new discoveries." Marie Sklodowska Curie
This Polish scientist is the only person with 2 Nobel Prizes in different disciplines (1903 in Physics, 1911 in Chemistry). Her genius contributed to improve our knowledge on radioactivity.

The Mayans were one of the most technically advanced society of Mesoamerica.
Its decline is one of the most thrilling mysteries of current archaeology.

This bomb was called Little Boy. A US Air Force bomber thrown it over the Japanese city of Hiroshima the 6th of August of 1945.
The first atomic bomb caused thousands of death and transformed warfare forever.

The second half of the XXth century was dominated by the so-called Cold War between United States and the Soviet Union.
During 40 years the world was on the verge of an atomic war that would probably ended with the human species.

This sheep was Dolly, and in 1996 she became the first mammal ever cloned.
Animal clonation was imagined years before in the book and movie Jurassic Park, where dinosaurs lived again thanks to genetic engineering.

“We are star stuff which has taken its destiny into its own hands.” Carl Sagan
He was probably the best science communicator that has ever lived. If you don't know his Cosmos tv series you should inmediately close this game and watch it!

The colonization of a populated place by another culture is often a dramatic clash.
This process was satirized by Ray Bradbury in his "Martian Chronicles", where he described the human colonization of the Red planet.
